website_summaries.verdict: Great introductory set with a good variety of pieces and instructions for a dozen models.
pros: Made for ages 3 and up, meaning even young children can have success with this toy
With 100 pieces, it's just the right size as a starter set because of the variety of pieces in the box, including spools, rods, and flags
Offers simple instructions to help you create 13 models
cons: May not offer enough pieces for those who are experienced with the toy

customer_reviews.title: Hours of play
customer_reviews.text: We bought the 100-pack thinking surely that's a lot of pieces, but when you open the box, it doesn't feel like there's that much. Despite that, my daughter loves these and can spend hours playing with them. I think as she gets older and more creative, we'll add to our collection, but for now, 100 pieces are enough for our 3.5-year-old. Other reviewers have mentioned having a hard time connecting and unconnecting pieces. We've never had that problem (unless my daughter is trying to accomplish the impossible). Gramma has the original wooden TinkerToys, and I find these to be a big improvement. I'm not worried about these breaking and the bendability feature makes for more building options.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica at Cracking the Cover

customer_reviews.title: Not enough pieces
customer_reviews.text: Great toy, not nearly enough pieces! My 5 year old loves these for building. It has a lot of potential for imaginary play. Its durable, well built. Its just the number of pieces 100, sounds like it should be plenty but its just not. Most of the time we build guns to play with and im always losing the soot out because there isnt enough pieces for me to build a good gun. of course i have to give my son the good pieces its his toy and if my husband joins in its really bad. We will be buying another set!
customer_reviews.author: Sage

customer_reviews.title: Good for visual spatial cognitive development
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son (6 years old) for Christmas to add to his 3 other sets. The pieces are different from his other sets which added to his ability to create objects and his excitement. He spends hours using his creativity and combines this with gears and other stem toys. I highly recommend this set! Over time you can expand the sets to give them so many choices for creativity. A++++ for any age! Good for visual spatial cognitive development. Have a blessed day.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie S.

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun for my grandkids!
customer_reviews.text: We've had tinker toys in our house for years. I loved them as a kid and I had an older set for my grandkids to play with when they came over. I ordered this set for my grandson, because he loves them. It had some new pieces that the old set didn't have. These are bright colored, new kinds of pieces to go with the old....just a great toy for young school aged children.
customer_reviews.author: RJS

customer_reviews.title: most of the useful longer sticks
customer_reviews.text: I had a very old set of wooden tinker toys growing up and remember playing with them with my cousins often. This set isn't really big enough for multiple kids to play with at the same time. If I build one contraption, most of the useful longer sticks, fans and wheels are in use and it cause a lot of squabbles. I would buy 2+ sets or a larger set for multiple kids. Otherwise, I've been reasonably satisfied with the switch to plastic.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Difficult for small children to put together, not enough pieces
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 2 year old. We knew he wouldn't be great at building much but thought he would enjoy just putting the pieces together. He likes it but the pieces are very difficult to snap together. There are not really enough pieces to build much even when we help him. Just two wheels???? Some of the pieces are a little weird and not useful. I wouldn't buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Gilly

customer_reviews.title: An hour of peace
customer_reviews.text: Both of my kids (5yo Male and 2yo Female) absolutely love these, buying more so they don't fight over who gets what. They ask for them on a regular basis. When I need to work on my computer they were always all over me, I give them these and I have at least an hour to get work done. Anyone who has young kids need these.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old can spend hours playing with this. I will add that seeing “100” pieces seems like a lot, but once you get the box you realize it’s a little limited. Perfect for maybe one or two kids to play with at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Farnham

customer_reviews.title: The red sticks came useless--not flexible and can't bend at all
customer_reviews.text: Kinda disappointed. We were given a 200-piece set that was missing some pieces, so we bought this 100-piece set as an add-on. For some reason, the red sticks are clearly not made out of the same flexible material as the ones in our first set. It sucks because the red sticks are meant SPECIFICALLY FOR BENDING in the designs, and they can't bend at all. My five-year-old tried and we could see the middle of the sticks turning pink from the stress and getting closer to breaking than bending. They're useless so we threw them away.
customer_reviews.author: Shauna

customer_reviews.title: Nice full set for the money
customer_reviews.text: Kids love Tinkertoys. The reason for 4 stars is that they are not backward compatible with the older plastic toys. These have a softer feel and the long ones are flexible so they are safer, but assume you are goig to have to invest in a new set and not add on.
customer_reviews.author: B'Radical

customer_reviews.title: Grandchildren Love These Tinkertoys!
customer_reviews.text: My young grandchildren love these Tinkertoys so much that I ordered this 100-piece set to combine with the 150-piece set we already had. When they saw the additional pieces that I added to the set, they were delighted. They have spent hours and hours playing and creating with these. The pieces are made of plastic and are of good quality. I would recommend them to those who want to use their imagination to create or to those who would like to make something from the included instruction sheet.
customer_reviews.author: K. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy
customer_reviews.text: Nice set Like that they still make this toy, but not the same wooden pieces as the ones from the 60’s. Grand kids like to play and make things. Will probably buy more sets to expand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous!!
customer_reviews.text: These are totally amazing and addicting!! You can let your imagination take over as you construct all sorts of creations. Bought these for my then 3yo but they have been fun for the whole family. I ended up buying a second set so that we could have double the parts and pieces. If you're familiar with the old wooden tinker toys, you have to try these. The same concept with newly updated pieces that twist and bend. The possibilities are endless!!!
customer_reviews.author: Total Boy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Sparks the creative mind!!!
customer_reviews.text: A terrific toy for developing fine motor skills and sparks the creative mind!!! I bought this for my twins 5 year old birthday. Within minutes they were building towers, vehicles and other things. The instructions are not too difficult - if they run into a rough patch I help them. This was so well received we bought a second set because 100 pieces just were not enough for 2 kids to build with.
customer_reviews.author: SFB

customer_reviews.title: ... for his birthday - and his brother and sister loved them so much as well
customer_reviews.text: I bought some of these at the store for my grandson for his birthday - and his brother and sister loved them so much as well, that I bought another set and sent it to them! Fantastic for kids' imagination.
customer_reviews.author: LynnEl

customer_reviews.title: Hours of entertainment!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my son's third birthday and they are a huge hit with him and my six year old son, as well! We prefer to buy open-ended toys that encourage kids to use their imaginations and these fit the bill perfectly! They are just as great as they were when I was a kid! Hours and hours of fun for kids 3 and up!
customer_reviews.author: Sean J.

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are children of the 80s, and these just aren’t what they used to be. While we knew they were now plastic, we thought they’d still be just as fun to build with, but they honestly aren’t. What’s also strange is that some of the pieces in the set are also in the kid k’nex set, so we kind of regretted buying both sets. It was just a weird purchase and I’m not sure I’d buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: WeLoveOllie

customer_reviews.title: Hard to put together
customer_reviews.text: These are bright and colorful but very difficult to put together. My three year old son can only play with these with help from an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay J Smiths iOS

customer_reviews.title: Not that easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my nephew's 5th birthday. He enjoys playing with them however they are a little tough to use. You have to use a lot of pressure to get the pieces in and out. More than a little person has. My mom decided to send these to his house and get the wooden ones to keep at her house. Hoping those will be a little easier. However the seller shipped them quickly and no issues with them. :)
customer_reviews.author: jkmom

customer_reviews.title: Cooperative fun, wider age span than expected
customer_reviews.text: My 4yo and 6yo are enjoying building with this set. I was surprised that the 6yo was interested, but the simple directions were compelling enough, and the models dynamic enough, to be interesting. Th 4yo can also build projects alone. They enjoy the bending parts and the ways they have learned to make parts spin.
customer_reviews.author: GHM

customer_reviews.title: Good old fashioned fun
customer_reviews.text: First of all, anyone complaining that they are too hard to snap or keep together has some larger issues. My four and eight year olds love playing with Tinker Toys and this set gives them everything they need to get started. Are they expensive? Yes, but they last.
customer_reviews.author: D. Dahlbeck

customer_reviews.title: Great Sturdy Product for Children of all Ages
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old son absolutely loves these. You can make so many different things from them, they are flexible, and not small to where you have to worry about them choking on them. They go together so easily also. He will sit and play with these for a while and uses his mind to create all kinds of different things. Great product and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to have to buy another box because 100 pieces aren't enough for two little boys. The only thing is that the booklet wasn't in the box to show all of the things that could be made. Maybe it got lost in the Christmas shuffle. Anyhow we make lots of abstract designs! Can you get a replacement booklet?
customer_reviews.author: Robert McGlohn

customer_reviews.title: I bought this as a Christmas gift, 100 pieces ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift, 100 pieces is not enough, get the bigger size and also with the round tube to keep them in.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Moon

customer_reviews.title: My grandson has not quit playing with this.
customer_reviews.text: This toy is an oldie but goodie. I would not have thought of buying this for my 7 year old grandson, but my daughter said he wanted this and I ordered them. He is using his imagination and creating all kinds of things
customer_reviews.author: B. Maidenberg

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old was not able to use this product so I think the age should be reset, however, product is colorful , fun, and lots of opportunity for creativity. 3 year old needs a lot of support to use but I think he will enjoy this toy later, maybe about 5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Creative
customer_reviews.text: Better than the ones I grew up with. I bought 2 as gifts for 3 kids to share. It has opened their imagination, helped with their creativity, and they don't fight when playing with this.
customer_reviews.author: Angela F. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Bought them for the grandson for his 3rd birthday, he loves them.
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for the grandson for his 3rd birthday, he loves them. If you are a man looking for a no-brainer purchase for your three year old grandson, this is your puppy.
customer_reviews.author: dr.mae

customer_reviews.title: Classic Toys
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for STEM toys for my daughter. I love classic toys like these Tinker Toys and was able to buy them while on sale from Amazon (100 piece set for $15). These encourage creativity and expand cognitive function as well as enhance motor skills. They are also quiet!
customer_reviews.author: SadieTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Tinker toys are no longer made of wood
customer_reviews.text: The pieces are brightly colored and the included photos are good but was disappointed that every piece is made of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: peg

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the old wooden ones
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as the old wooden tinker toys we had as kids in the 60’s and 70’s
customer_reviews.author: Steve Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Bought it as a gift to my daughter in college!
customer_reviews.text: Professor is teaching students to make 3-D models of atoms and molecules using this construction toy for a child, age 3 and up!
customer_reviews.author: GKrish

customer_reviews.title: Ahhh nostalgia😊
customer_reviews.text: I saw these and had to get them for my lil guy. I had these as a kid but they were made of wood. He enjoys them just as much as I did.
customer_reviews.author: Mira F

customer_reviews.title: These are the best toys for a "Grand-Pappy" and a 3yr old "Little ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the best toys for a "Grand-Pappy" and a 3yr old "Little Sweetie"!!! She loves these. I have only one special notice. There are no Blue Wheels in this package. My mistake but, hopefully this will keep someone else from making the same. If you don't need wheels to supplant your existing supply, then this is PERFECT!!! Happy Building! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Paul Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my grandson for Christmas. He just loves it. Uses it with his Knex and Lincoln logs and magnitiles to build his dino city.
customer_reviews.author: C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It's a great use of there imagination! It's better than Legos!
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a winner in the house. The pieces are large, are durable. When they drop their creation it doesn't break like Legos. I love they use their imagination and build things I would not have thought of. This set is a small set it's difficult for two kids to build at the same time but perfect for one. I'll be purchasing more.
customer_reviews.author: dudette

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these and at 6 years old he can follow the instructions and build all of the examples on his own. Very easy to use and creates so many different displays
customer_reviews.author: mrsnurse08

customer_reviews.title: tinkertoy fun
customer_reviews.text: this is a fun beginner set. while it seems 100 pieces are a lot, they're not! ordered the set of 150 to make more "stuff"! this is such a great way to watch kids gain fine motor skills.
customer_reviews.author: K. otoole

customer_reviews.title: Creative fun
customer_reviews.text: I still prefer the wooden classic version but this works for adults and kids.
customer_reviews.author: amberhughes

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Everything is plastic these days - I guess we can't be having splinters in the little kiddies hands.
customer_reviews.author: Albanygolfer

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old loves building with these. Great gift idea too!
customer_reviews.author: Sswartz

customer_reviews.title: For 1 person play
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves to build “fans and motors” with them. Only problem is going to have to buy more his his younger brother to play with also. Sounds like a lot of pieces but isn't. Overall good buy just shoukd of bought the bigger box.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Open ended creative play
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this is the pregame to k-nex. My kid is almost 4 and it's a great creative tool for open ended play. Just maybe don't bend the long pieces. They bend in not a good way with enough force. Durable to a point.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my Godchild's son and he loves it. I have a similar one for my son when he was a little boy. My grandchildren and all children come home and they love to play with it and I help them build different things. This is a great gift for any child.
customer_reviews.author: maureen waguespack

customer_reviews.title: Great Tinkertoys
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome. My 3 year old grandson and 6 year old granddaughter love them. You need to get two boxes to have enough. They are made really well and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: My child liked them but doesn't play with them very much because ...
customer_reviews.text: Too big for other K'nex and was not what I expected. My child liked them but doesn't play with them very much because they are too big. They are durable and seller was great
customer_reviews.author: RKA124816

customer_reviews.title: Tinkertoy fun
customer_reviews.text: Fun toy that let's the child use their imagination. The pieces are sturdy even after many hours of play - none of them broken!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Wish they were more pieces in a box but great quality
customer_reviews.author: Andrea J.

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of options for the kids to create things. My kids (3 and 6) spend hours playing with them. It would be nice if they came with some kind of permanent container. So many have been lost that I just bought a second set. The longer pieces are flexible and can bend too easily, but I assume this is for safety reasons.
customer_reviews.author: Fawn's Purchases

customer_reviews.title: Ageless always
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren ages 4 and 6 spend hours using their imagination creating and building to their hearts content. Thiis is something that is ageless and lets all children regardless of age, gender and handicap feel good and confident.
customer_reviews.author: shop4me

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I was stunned the Tinker toys were not wooden but now thrilled they are not. Granddaughter (3) took to a New Years party. So many people on floor playing with this. I especially loved the flower hubby made. Can’t do that with wooden toys.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Buske

customer_reviews.title: Yay-ish
customer_reviews.text: These are a great toy! My only real complaint is that one needs to buy multiple sets to really build anything.
customer_reviews.author: KatieND

customer_reviews.title: Tinker Toys are still fun!!
customer_reviews.text: I remember Tinker Toys growing up, now my grandchildren - 3 & 4 love these. They are plastic now instead of wood, but still the same and we really love watching them create things.
customer_reviews.author: ajordan

customer_reviews.title: Tinkertoys
customer_reviews.text: Bought a set of these Tinkertoys as a Christmas present for my grandsons (ages 4 and 6) and they loved them. Ordered an additional set for Easter and it was delivered and snatched off the porch before dad could get to them. Such a shame that people act so criminally.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest F. Dean

customer_reviews.title: Great for imagination
customer_reviews.text: I bough this for my son who is autistic. He sets and builds things for hours. He loves them
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Doubledee

customer_reviews.title: Wish there were more stick pieces to play with!
customer_reviews.text: I was totally disappointed in the amount of pieces available for the kids. There are only enough pieces to make the projects they show. There weren’t enough of the straight pieces for my grandson to make his own invention! The directions showed red pieces that bend, ours didn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 6 year old little boy loved them!
customer_reviews.text: My godson (6 years old) loved this! His older brother (10) and my husband sat down and created random little tinkers for hours. Only downside is you may want to buy a box to keep these in as it doesn't come with one. A great starter kit and alternative to Legos :)
customer_reviews.author: A. Lee

customer_reviews.title: He put together some truly awesome and large creations
customer_reviews.text: My nephew was ecstatic. He put together some truly awesome and large creations. This is perfect started kit because it has 100 parts so the child can really let their imagination run wild. I highly recommend this set for any kid over age of 3 who likes to put things together. Multi color gender neutral palette is nice touch .
customer_reviews.author: Amazonka

customer_reviews.title: Great for the imagination!
customer_reviews.text: We love these. Great for my 2.5 year old. Easy to build and the kit comes with an instruction sheet for designs that can be made with the pieces provided.
customer_reviews.author: WA

customer_reviews.title: Have bought a couple of these, one for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Have bought a couple of these, one for my toddler, and another for a gift. My son loves to play with these.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Momma

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle construction elements
customer_reviews.text: This is a flexible, adaptable collection of Tinkertoys. Our five-year old easily optimized its potential.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: gave as a gift for Christmas the kids loved them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice set of Tinkertoys
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of Tinkertoys...good variety of pieces for kids to use their imaginations...grandson gravitates to them every day. He really enjoys building different things.
customer_reviews.author: fla_usa

customer_reviews.title: Promotes creativity!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Tinkertoy set for my 4 year old grandson. He absolutely loves it and has built numerous things. This is a wonderful way to promote creativity while having fun. It seems to be made well.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Norton

customer_reviews.title: Fun educational toy!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 yo son LOVES these!! He plays with them every day!
customer_reviews.author: Amie C Cargola

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These have been a big hit with my first grade students. They have asked me to buy more!
customer_reviews.author: adkmeg

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: I gave this toy to my grandson for Christmas and he absolutely loves it. My daughter has been sending me pictures of different things that he built and hes only 3 years old.
customer_reviews.author: James K. Hardiman

customer_reviews.title: One happy grandson at Christmas
customer_reviews.text: One happy grandson at Christmas, heck on wheels and cant break these. Grandson bends pieces to invent things and nothing breaks. Amazing when they were wood but more versatile now that they flex. Great upgrade to what I had as a child.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: I was used to the wooden tinker toys so the ...
customer_reviews.text: I was used to the wooden tinker toys so the plastic tinker toys took a little bit of time to get used to but my two-year-old granddaughter actually prefers them to the wood
customer_reviews.author: Jill P. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Fun!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my oldest child's fourth birthday gift, and my 2 year old and 1 year old love them, too!!!!! I would definitely recommend them for some quiet, imaginative, STEM play!!!
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Safer these days
customer_reviews.text: These are way less stabby than when I grew up. The kids love them. Timeless (well safer now) toy
customer_reviews.author: Bobo Blackboots

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Kept my 4 year old busy for 2 weeks! He played with nothing else but these! They are really nice. I wish they could be the wood, but they are well made.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The only problem was that you have to bend some of the pieces to make certain shapes and it kind of ruins the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer b.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Dad and boy immediately started to build a great big windmill.
customer_reviews.author: Maxine S. Green

customer_reviews.title: Plastic vs wood.
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that they are all plastic vs wood. I do like that they are made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky Fin

customer_reviews.title: Great way to use creativity
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my granddaughter not only does she love them but so does her teenage uncle.
customer_reviews.author: brandy

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful!!! Will buy more! Durable and perfect for builders who have gotten board with Legos or for a developing mind.
customer_reviews.author: Ken C.

customer_reviews.title: Great learning toy and lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my four-year-old granddaughter. It was a great success. She loved building with the tinker toys and experimenting with her own "architectural" designs. A wonderful learning tool as well.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Siniawer

customer_reviews.title: Tinkertoys Are Tops!
customer_reviews.text: Tinker toys get an upgrade! My grandson loved our old set of Tinkertoys so much I ordered him his own set. He was so thrilled.

customer_reviews.title: My 4 year old really likes to build things. ...
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old really likes to build things. I was hoping my 2 year old would be able to share. The pieces are very hard to snap together. In the future I think I will be getting the full sized k'nex
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice but I like wood better
customer_reviews.text: These are nice but I like the old wooden ones better even with all their faults. Maybe because I'm old.

customer_reviews.title: We like!
customer_reviews.text: Fun toys for all to enjoy! So long as you don't mind picking up lots of pieces with your toddler/child :)

customer_reviews.title: Good product and good service

customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wrong pieces
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. The one I ordered had hard plastic pieces for the long red ones but they were supposed to be bendable. Most of these have broken now.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Still fun to play with, but made of cheap plastic instead of wood
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy for my almost three year old son for Christmas. My husband and I both loved tinkertoys as kids, but it is really sad that these are made of cheap plastic now.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren V.

customer_reviews.title: While these are not the classic wooden pieces I remember ...
customer_reviews.text: While these are not the classic wooden pieces I remember from my childhood, they are well built. My little guys sure loves them!
customer_reviews.author: brit

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My child has really enjoyed playing with this set. it arrived in the box - all together - nothing bent, etc. Great toy! My child is very 'hands on' and this has kept him entertained.
customer_reviews.author: Misty G

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old grandson AND my son in law have a blast with this set. Perfect introduction to Tinker Toys for little ones.
customer_reviews.author: NH Mom

customer_reviews.title: Childhood favorite rediscovered
customer_reviews.text: I’ve enjoyed Tinkertoys since I was a child. These new plastic pieces are more durable for my students.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ole Tinkertoys
customer_reviews.text: Grandkids enjoy them, though I liked the original ones better. Good price, quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: SandraFree

customer_reviews.title: YES!  You need this.
customer_reviews.text: Grandkids play with these over and over - great to have around for kids who visit - to keep them occupied!

customer_reviews.title: 2. 5 year old loves it. Wish we ...
customer_reviews.text: 2.5 year old loves it. Wish we would had purchased bigger set to start with.
customer_reviews.author: Karri R.

customer_reviews.title: Great but more pierces definitely needed
customer_reviews.text: Endless hours of fun but you do need to buy additional pieces.
customer_reviews.author: pamela saunders

customer_reviews.title: Wish they were still made of wood.
customer_reviews.text: I wish they were still made out of wood. The plastic seems cheap but my Grand kids like to play with them. I don't think they will last long. Glad I got them at a deep discount.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful to have to fill my little creative minds when they come to visit!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A classic-but better!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old son loves these! Much better price here than in a store. We have 2 sets we put together and he stays busy for hours!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Nimetz

product_meta.title: TINKERTOY ‒ 100 Piece Essentials Value Set ‒ Ages 3+ Preschool Education Toy
product_meta.description:
Watch children enhance their imaginations with the most popular TINKERTOY set to date: theTINKERTOY 100 Pieces Essentials Value Set!

TINKERTOY 100 Piece Essentials Value Set contains 100 parts and pieces, including spools, rods, flags, washers, end caps, and more. These pieces can snap and bend to form different shapes, and they can be interconnected to create more complex yet simple-to-build structures. They snap together and stay together, preventing kids’ creations from falling apart and guaranteeing long-lasting play. 

 Young builders can create 13 models with the help of an instruction sheet that comes with the package. Parents can guide them through this training manual until they get the hang of it. Or, let your kids’ imaginations run wild, unleashing their creative potential as they bring different designs to life.

Toy parts and pieces can be stored in the set’s sturdy box. Parents can simply put the toy parts inside the box after every playtime session and store it on a shelf or in a cabinet for later use. This makes cleanup easier and faster, while keeping living spaces tidy and organized. 

Aside from offering tons of fun for children and exercising their imaginative muscles, TINKERTOY also supports their growth in key areas of development. This toy strengthens hand-eye coordination, fine motor skills, problem-solving skills, and spatial awareness. Plus, TINKERTOY is 100% made in America at a landfill-free, zero-waste green manufacturing facility in Hatfield, Pennsylvania. It has been tested to the strictest quality and safety standards, ensuring that children will enjoy a hassle-free playtime experience. 

Allow young minds to play intelligently and have fun creatively with TINKERTOY!
feature_bullets: 100 ASSORTED PIECES – The TINKERTOY 100 Piece Essentials Value Set contains 100 authentic pieces in various vibrant colors, made 100% in the USA. Package components include spools, rods, flags, washers, end caps, and more. These parts can snap and bend to create whatever a child imagines into a real-life creation.

13 BUILDING IDEAS – Children can create 13 different models with this colorful set. Parts can be combined to make a car with wheels, a flower, a house, a windmill, and a four-legged animal. Let your kids’ imaginations run wild, unleashing their creative potential as they bring different designs to life with this imaginative set.

CONVENIENT STORAGE – The pieces of this innovative toy can be kept inside the included storage container. This sturdy box makes the set highly portable, so transporting it anywhere is easy. After every playtime session, parents can simply place the toy parts inside the box and store it for later use. This makes cleanup easy and fast. Keep living spaces tidy and organized, and never have to worry about stray or missing parts.

INCLUDES INSTRUCTION SHEET – This TINKERTOY set comes with an instruction manual to guide children through their building adventures. The sheet comes with construction ideas and tips for little builders, so youngsters can create structures on their own. Parents can also walk their kids through the manual and guide them until they get the hang of it.

SNAPS TOGETHER, STAYS TOGETHER: Gone are the days of your favorite TINKERTOY model falling apart. TINKERTOY sets now Snap Together, Stay together for long-lasting play. The bright colored parts are easy to put together, but stay together for great after build playing.

DEVELOPMENT BENEFITS: TINKERTOY supports key areas of a child’s development growth. As the stack the different part together and discover how the building system works, they’re strengthening hand-eye coordination, fine motor skills, problem-solving skills, spatial awareness and exercising their imagination!

COMMITMENT TO QUALITY: TINKERTOY spools, rods, flags, washers and end caps are responsibly made in America at a landfill-free, zero-waste green manufacturing facility in Hatfield, Pennsylvania. We test to the strictest quality and safety standards, ensuring that your child has a successful, trouble-free building experience.

PARTS GUARANTEE: Broken part? Missing part? If you find yourself in need of a replacement for any reason, just give us a call! We’ll get you what you need so that your child can get back to building as soon as possible.
